O NAMOA É UMA FERRAMENTA COMPUTACIONAL Q: Namoa is a computational tool that assists in the selection of tour itineraries and in the budget management of the trip. Through a search algorithm that finds relevant results based on user preferences, it is possible, through a simple and intuitive interface, to define the number of days in each city, how much will be spent daily and the places to be visited.
A POSSIBILIDADE DE INSERIR NOVOS TRADES: The possibility of inserting new tourist trades (hotels, restaurants, bars, discos, means of transport and tourist attractions), make the tool dynamic and intuitive, as they allow the planning of a script and its real-time customization.
A BUSCA DOS PONTOS PARA O ROTEIRO OCORRE: The search for the points for the script occurs after filling in information that aims to draw the profile of the user, in order to better target the searches according to their lifestyle, preferences and purchasing power. All this is accessible through web platform or mobile devices.
O MODELO DE NEGÓCIO QUE MANTÉM ESTE PROJ: The business model that maintains this project is realized through packages of clicks from ads searches that the users realize, at the moment in which they construct the itinerary tourist. charging only occurs if the tourist clicks on that trade.
OUTRO DIFERENCIAL É O FATO DE QUE O TURI: Another difference is the fact that the tourist can give feedback to the visited establishment, promoting the continuous improvement of the quality of the service provided.
3. QUAL SERÁ A EXPECTATIVA QUANTO À MÉDI: 3. What is the expectation regarding the average daily budget per person?
4. QUAL É A RENDA MENSAL FAMILIAR?: 4. What is the monthly family income?
6. QUANTO TEMPO COSTUMA DURAR AS SUAS FÉ: 6. How long does your vacation last?
7. COM QUEM COSTUMA PASSSAR AS FÉRIAS?: 7. Who do you usually spend your vacation with?
8. ATRAVÉS DE QUAL MEIO DE TRANSPORTE CO: 8. By what means of transportation do you usually travel to the place?
9. QUAL TIPO DE TURISMO COSTUMA PREFERIR: 9. What kind of tourism do you prefer?
10. DURANTE AS FÉRIAS, ONDE CUSTUMA PERN: 10. During the holidays, where do you usually stay overnight?
11. QUAIS FONTES DE INFORMAÇÃO SÃO CONSU: 11. What information sources are consulted for vacation planning?
12. POR FAVOR, AVALIE EM UMA ESCALA DE 1: 12. Please rate on a scale from 1 (little) to 5 (much) how much you value the hosting trade according to the following criteria
13. POR FAVOR, AVALIE EM UMA ESCALA DE 1: 13. Please rate on a scale from 1 to 5 how much you value the feed trade, according to the following criteria
14. POR FAVOR, AVALIE EM UMA ESCALA DE 1: 14. Please rate on a scale from 1 to 5 how much you value the city's attractions according to the following criteria
15. VOCÊ JÁ OUVIU FALAR DO CONCEITO ECON: 15. Have you heard of the concept of Experience Economy?
SIM E CONHEÇO BASTANTE: Yes, and I know a lot
16. CITE UMA CIDADE QUE GOSTOU DE VISITA: 16. Name a city you liked to visit
17. CITE UM LOCAL QUE RECOMENDARIA O SER: 17. Name a place that would recommend the service

USE OS RECURSOS NATURAIS, COMO ÁGUA E EN: Use natural resources such as water and energy in moderation. Remember that they are scarce.
AO PLANEJAR SUA VIAGEM, ESCOLHA OS FORNE: When planning your trip, choose suppliers that offer quality assurances and respect for human rights and the environment.
DÊ PREFERÊNCIA POR PRODUTOS BIODEGRADÁVE: Give preference for biodegradable products, especially when visiting places of untouchable nature and with little infrastructure. At this site, the waste usually goes directly to rivers, seas and dumps, without any treatment.
NUNCA COMPRE PRODUTOS OU SOUVENIRES FEIT: Never buy products or souvenirs made from native or endangered species of plants or animals.
RESPEITE O MEIO AMBIENTE. NUNCA TOQUE OU: Respect the environment. Never touch or scare animals. Always follow the tracks. Support conservation by paying entry fees at protected parks and sites.
LEVE SEMPRE SUA GARRAFA REUTILIZÁVEL (E: Always carry your reusable bottle (and remember to fill it wherever possible). This will avoid unnecessary use of many plastic packaging.
QUANDO FOR FAZER TRILHAS, MANTENHA-SE NO: When making trails, stay on track. Leaving the marked trails causes erosion and other impacts on nature.
EVITE EMBALAGENS. QUANDO FOR VIAJAR LEVE: When traveling, take with you your own shampoo, cream and liquid soap. This avoids the use of individual packaging of these products.
ECONOMIZE ÁGUA! TOME BANHOS CURTOS…A MÉD: Save water! Take short baths. The average spend of one guest is 300 liters of water per night. In a luxury hotel this average is almost 1,800 liters.
ECONOMIZE ENERGIA! DESLIGUE O CARREGADOR: Save energy! Disconnect the charger from the phone when the battery is full and turn off the lights and electrical appliances when you leave the room.
PREFIRA ESTABELECIMENTOS ILUMINAÇÃO LED: Prefer light-duty outlets or compact fluorescent bulbs instead of incandescent bulbs because they last longer.
COLOQUE UMA CAMADA EXTRA DE ROUPA EM VEZ: Put on an extra layer of clothing instead of turning on the heating.
ABRA AS PERSIANAS E USE O MÁXIMO DE LUZ: Open the shades and use as much natural light as possible before turning on the light bulbs.
APAGUE AS LUZES QUANDO SAIR DE UM QUARTO: Turn off the lights when you leave a room.
PENDURE ROUPAS MOLHADAS EM UMA LINHA DE: Hang wet clothes on a drying line or rack instead of using a power dryer.
LAVE SUAS ROUPAS MANUALMENTE, ESPECIALME: Wash your clothes manually, especially if you only have a few items to clean.
COMECE A CRONOMETRAR SEUS CHUVEIROS. OU: Start timing your showers, or better yet, invest in a shower timer.
PREFIRA RESTAURANTES QUE CONSOMEM PRODUT: Prefer restaurants that consume products with organic fertilizers.
ALUGUE UMA BICICLETA USADA E COMECE A US: Rent a used bike and start using it anywhere.
QUANDO POSSÍEL, PREFIRA AS ESCADAS AO EL: When possible, prefer the stairs to the elevator.
DÊ PREFERÊNCIA AO TRANSPORTE PÚBLICO. TA: Give preference to public transport. it's also an excellent opportunity to keep track of reading and other things you could not do if you were driving.
NÃO USE SACOLAS PLÁSTICAS EM MERCADOS E: Do not use plastic bags in markets and pharmacies. Instead, prefer your own shopping bags.
COMPRE OS SEUS PRODUTOS A GRANEL A PARTI: Buy your products in bulk from local markets.
COMPRE ROUPAS DE SEGUNDA MÃO SEMPRE QUE: Buy second hand clothes whenever possible.
INVISTA EM ITENS DE MELHOR QUALIDADE QUE: Invest in better quality items that last longer. Slow fashion outperforms fast fashion.
APOIE MARCAS DE MODA QUE SEJAM ÉTICAS E: Support fashion brands that are ethical and environmentally conscious.
Turn off your computer before leaving.
PREFIRA GARRAFAS DE AÇO INOXIDÁVEL (OU P: Prefer stainless steel bottles (or at least without plastic).
USE CANUDOS DE METAL LAVÁVEIS EM VEZ DE: Use washable metal straws instead of disposable plastic straws.
Use cold water when washing dishes.
Use cloths instead of paper towels.
FAÇA SEU PRÓPRIO CAFÉ EM VEZ DE COMPRAR: Make your own coffee instead of buying to go.
LIMITE A QUANTIDADE DE ÁGUA QUE VOCÊ USA: Limit the amount of water you use to brush your teeth.
DÊ EXPERIÊNCIAS ÀS PESSOAS EM VEZ DE COI: Give people experiences instead of things.
RECICLE SEUS DISPOSITIVOS QUANDO ESTIVER: Recycle your devices when you are ready to discard.
DOE SEUS DISPOSITIVOS ANTIGOS PARA ESCOL: Donate your old devices to schools and other institutions.
EMPRESTE LIVROS DA BIBLIOTECA EM VEZ DE: Lend books from the library instead of buying them directly.
LEIA SUAS PUBLICAÇÕES DE JORNAL FAVORITA: Read your favorite newspaper publications online instead of reading the paper versions.
REGULARMENTE PREPARAR REFEIÇÕES CASEIRAS: Regularly prepare homemade meals and save on travel storage containers.
